body_html:
New numbers:

In [1]: import torch
In [2]: x = torch.randn(100, 100, requires_grad=True)

In [3]: %timeit -n1000 torch.relu(x)
10.7 µs ± 402 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)
In [4]: %timeit -n1000 torch.nn.functional.threshold(x, 0, 0)
14.9 µs ± 677 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)

In [5]: %timeit -n1000 torch.relu(x).sum().backward()
118 µs ± 15.2 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)
In [6]: %timeit -n1000 torch.nn.functional.threshold(x, 0, 0).sum().backward()
142 µs ± 31.8 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)

Thanks @zou3519

body:
New numbers:

```
In [1]: import torch
In [2]: x = torch.randn(100, 100, requires_grad=True)

In [3]: %timeit -n1000 torch.relu(x)
10.7 µs ± 402 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)
In [4]: %timeit -n1000 torch.nn.functional.threshold(x, 0, 0)
14.9 µs ± 677 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)

In [5]: %timeit -n1000 torch.relu(x).sum().backward()
118 µs ± 15.2 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)
In [6]: %timeit -n1000 torch.nn.functional.threshold(x, 0, 0).sum().backward()
142 µs ± 31.8 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000 loops each)
```

Thanks @zou3519
